intro: Cymbocarpum, commonly known as the silverleaf tree or candelabra tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Chenopodiaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in South America. They are shrubs or small trees characterized by their branching structure and small, often spiny leaves. The flowers are typically greenish or yellowish, and the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Cymbocarpum species are adapted to harsh environments, showing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
